website_summaries.verdict: A good cover for larger RV trailers, especially when you need something that will accommodate sliding panels.
pros: Uses a 3-layer fabric design that keeps the elements from damaging the trailer underneath
Adjustable tension panels on the front and rear keep the covers secure during high winds
Multiple zippered panels allow access to the RV doors and engine area
cons: Certain corners can tear on sharp trailer edges in high winds

customer_reviews.title: This travel trailer cover has been great protecting the unit
customer_reviews.text: This travel trailer cover has been great protecting the unit. I live in Arizona with extreme heat, rain, and high winds. I store my travel trailer outside so the cover has been put to the test with the elements of the desert. I really like the air vents, and the zipper access points. The straps are well made, and a bonus with the corner reflectors. I will be buying your product again in the future. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Tore in under two months. Good fit otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with this cover to begin with but after less than two months it has torn. I tried contacting Amazon and Leader Accessories about the two year warranty and each company tells me to contact the other. Communication with Leader Accessories is not good. No call back and email is lacking all professionalism.
customer_reviews.author: Lehnora

customer_reviews.title: the 18-20 Fit my TT 20' Box nice and snug
customer_reviews.text: the 18-20 Fit my TT 20' Box nice and snug. I am pleased. I used pool noodles on corners and covering my rain spouts. Been on since Oct, several winter snow and ice storms, and still holding up fine. If I get 2 seasons out of it, for the price, I'll be pleased. Follow instructions... The negative feedback, not surprising, but they probably did not install and take recommended precautions. Update: Nov 2019. Ive used 2 seasons, just installed for 3rd, and confident it will be fine. I don't get the negative comments, they must not be protecting sharp edges on camper (i use some swim noodles)
customer_reviews.author: Paul S

customer_reviews.title: Went on good. My husband and son put it on
customer_reviews.text: Went on good. My husband and son put it on. Said it was helpful to have two working on it. We put foam around the sharp edges. The material seems to be good quality and breathable. The zip door was very helpful when we forgot to do something in the camper and needed to get in. So far happy with purchase. Will see after 1st winter.
customer_reviews.author: Beth V

customer_reviews.title: It seems to be a good enough quality for the money
customer_reviews.text: The cover came on time. It fit the trailer with a little to much room to spare, but we are not talking tailor made covers here. It seems to be a good enough quality for the money. The only thing I wish these cover manufactures would do would be to re-inforse the areas around the corners. I know the corners do not always match in the same places on each trailer, so maybe a double thickness in the area. I know it was cold when we put this on and our fingers were freezing, so we did not pad the corners. I know we will pay for this, but it is what it is.
customer_reviews.author: beacon bright

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: We have only had this cover for a few months & with the first big wind storm that came threw it now has three big tears. They seem to be in an area that I would think the material should of been reinforced. I now have to repair it & the company did not provide nearly enough material for repairs! Waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Corinna Velasquez

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Within a couple months coin sized holes started to appear, before we reached the 6 month mark a three foot long strip tore. Multiple phone calls made during the company's stated business hours only got us their voicemail. After leaving 4 voice messages, they finally reached out via email, offering less than half of the purchase price. It again took multiple emails before they finally agreed to refund the full purchase amount. Overall a very poor product, and an even worse customer service experience
customer_reviews.author: Larissa L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Decent cover.
customer_reviews.text: It works. But it tore on the top when we were trying to pull it over - and my husband was even on the roof guiding it along. I had read a comment that said the top was thicker, but i didn't find that to be true. Never-the-less, we duck-taped the tear and the cover has stayed on and did it's job.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy G Hord

customer_reviews.title: Decent cover
customer_reviews.text: This is my second cover, the first one lasted a year and a half of almost constant use, held up well to high winds, rain, snow but the sun cooked the top and it disintegrated. I talked to the company and even though it has a 2 year warranty they would only give 50% credit toward a new cover
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This was a two man job to install and easily done. We installed in on a calm day only two months ago without any problems. Came back yesterday to get something out of the trailer and found it completely ripped to pieces! The entire side ripped down three seams! There is also a large hole in the top front of the cover. Such poor workmanship! Completely disappointed! Complete waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: mindyjoyrn

customer_reviews.title: Torn in less than 1 month
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfect on our trailer, however after less than 1 month it already has 2 rips. Cheap fabric, torn on sides not at the seams just random places. Waste of $200 because it'll need to be replaced soon. *Update* lasted almost 3 years and RIP to shreds during a wind storm 😠
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This was our first purchase from Leader. We purchased this for my father's camper in 2019. We were surprised how it fits and how easy it was to put on and take off. We went this past weekend and noticed 4 rips in it. These rips were caused by the campers rain gutters. Now we know for when we close it this year, make sure we cover those points. We contacted Leaders and within 72hours they contacted us back. Very professional and reasonable offer. The 4 small rips can be fixed. We are pleased and will do business with them again. (In the picture we already undid the straps so that's why it looks loose)
customer_reviews.author: stacey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Access With Cover On
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cover for a trailer I'm restoring. The trailer leaks like a sieve, and I thought this would be a good temporary solution while I work on it. It turns out that this is a perfect solution. With the various zippers and velcro, I can access different areas of the trailer to remove windows and siding for repair and replacement. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Eric S

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed & have requested a return/refund
customer_reviews.text: This is a poorly made cover! We opened it to find a tear in it before ever using it. Very disappointed & have requested a return/refund. 😡
customer_reviews.author: Raven

customer_reviews.title: I’m satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Great price and it seems to be a good cover. I HIGHLY SUGGEST TAPING FOAM AROUND ANY SLIGHTEST SHARP CORNERS OR OBSTRUCTIONS. It caught easily on a few edges as I applied it, did not tear, but appeared close to doing so. As of now it’s a great cover for the money and seems to be doing a great job. It’s been on for two weeks with plenty of wind and rain at a storage lot. I will go check on it in the coming week and if any issues I’ll update this. If not updated I recommend this cover
customer_reviews.author: Iseedumbpeople

customer_reviews.title: Seems decent for the money but definitely not fitted.
customer_reviews.text: Seems ok. Had a tear right out of the box but I could not let that derail my timeline to get this covered in storage. It would be nice if seller would give me some compensation for the tear. Had to use a 6”x6” square of the repair patch right out of the box! Had to get on the roof but once I started to lay it out and pulling it down the sides it was ok. Sides fit well but front and rear had a lot of excess fabric and seemed not to get tight enough to get wrinkles out.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Fit very well and very simple to put on and ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit very well and very simple to put on and take off. The fabric seems to be very durable and with the straps that you connect keep it secured down.
customer_reviews.author: camlav4872

customer_reviews.title: Works, make sure measure and add
customer_reviews.text: Didn't fit my trailer ordered the proper size and either got a smaller 1 on accident who knows . But the quality is great , Vegas heat beats up trailers and anything else not to mention the high winds . With the tie downs it is secure and are able to be cable locked as well. It if fit properly and I received exactly what I ordered would of been better . But want to order next level up soon
customer_reviews.author: Eric J.

customer_reviews.title: Not big enough for a 29' camper
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly, bought this a couple of years back and hadn't taken it out of its box. Went to put the cover on the camper today , 4 of us fenangled the cover over the camper from the roof and everything looked good, apart from being a little tight at the ends. Got off the roof and started doing the zippers and then it tore Super disappointed, super annoyed that i wasted mine and 3 buddies time doing this, for this to happen. It is now sitting in the bottom of a red dumpster!!!!! Not happy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: L. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money- fabric is too thin
customer_reviews.text: Order & delivery were good, installation was good, fabric will not stand up to the elements, wind tore the fabric like tissue paper, any soft corners wore through in 1 day, spent hours uninstalling and patching in hopes it doesn’t spread further. Spend a little more and get better fabric
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it no stars if it would have let me. The cover is not made for a curved nose camper. The material is not as heavy duty as they claim. It ripped twice trying to put it on. I have a 26 ft camper and ordered the 24-27 and it still doesn't fit. Waste of $200.00.
customer_reviews.author: H.Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Trash that fails before a year in the sun
customer_reviews.text: This didn't last a year. The top is made of a breathable material and after less than a year of normal exposure the top split simply from the weight of the sides. After less than a year in the sun the material can be torn with two fingers and disintegrates in your hand. I had covered all sharp edges and the cover was snug (no flapping). Areas around the bumper and steps that were difficult to cover developed tears but I expected and remedied that.
customer_reviews.author: eph

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: This cover lasted one year before disintegrating. The entire top portion is rotten. Zero stars for durability
customer_reviews.author: Ryan V

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size, bad instructions
customer_reviews.text: I honestly don’t know if they sent us the wrong size or not, but we ordered the 18’-20’ size and there were nearly 6’ of extra material hanging off the back of our 18’ camper. At that point it was too much hassle to try to exchange it. The instructions were also terrible-both hard to follow and incomplete with just one small blurry black and white picture of the cover installed to try and work from. Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: J. Seeley

customer_reviews.title: seems to work
customer_reviews.text: bought one too big, but that's ok. Covers entire 18' trailer, including bumper, spare tire and hitch, right down to ground. Have only had it a couple months but no problems. Kind of hard to get on, but I think that would be the case for any cover on a trailer or rv. Fabric is not exceptionally strong, so you have to be careful on sharp edges. Padded sharper edges with foam pipe insulation,.
customer_reviews.author: mcpapa

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t fit
customer_reviews.text: I have a 28 RKS Forest River Avenger and this cover was suppose to fit up to 30 ft. Well it didn’t. Was a foot short. So frustrating. Ended up taping down around the last non existent foot. Praying it makes it through a Michigan windy fall and snowy winter.
customer_reviews.author: Terrie L. Winkates

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with products.
customer_reviews.text: We were absolutely amazed at how easy the cover went on. We are very pleased with both the cover and the tire covers. Products are made very well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I’ll probably buy it again, which means I’ll need to.
customer_reviews.text: Kind of a pain to put on. The buckle straps sometimes come loose, but it doesn’t fall off. The bottom rear corners of my camper and the pointy rain gutters poked holes in it after only about 2wks, but given that the holes are at the bottom at the rain gutter that moves water away anyway I’m not too worried. However, it would be better if it didn’t break at all.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Nietupski

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in March and didn't install it until December. That's when I found out that a 27 - 30' cover was too small for my 27' camper. The back fit fine but when it came to the front we were about 12" short of material to zip up one front corner. I ended up taping in some plastic underneath and then a bunch of Gorilla tape to keep it closed. It looks like this is made for a squared off camper instead of the tapered wind resistant ones.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Suminski

customer_reviews.title: Watch your size,clearly doesn't match description
customer_reviews.text: Travel trailer is a 29 foot trailer, has the sloped front like the description, bought the 29 to 30 foot cover and there was no way that cover was going on my trailer. Length was one issue but even corner to corner on the back of the trailer it was so tight, there was no way it was going on. A little frustrating getting it boxed back up since it is shipped vacuum packed.
customer_reviews.author: Paul S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Basic Cover
customer_reviews.text: This cover fit our 25 foot Puma nicely. No troubles covering air conditioning unit. The sides cover the trailer. It was very windy...30 mph winds; And no issues whatsoever stayed in place. We love this basic cover. We can still get inside the trailer if needed and it is protected from outside elements. It was a very good value for the price. The shipping was fast and order had no trouble getting here.
customer_reviews.author: RevCarolyn

customer_reviews.title: Good RV cover for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This cover requires someone to get on the roof of the RV unless you have something pretty small. Instructions seemed minimal but there are tags sewn into the cover that say front and back which are very helpful. I like the strap that goes around the middle as it keeps the cover from billowing in the wind. It also secures underneath by three or four straps which also prevent it from becoming a giant kite. I think it will do the job nicely. As this is our first season using it, I have no insight into durability at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Mary K

customer_reviews.title: Hope it last......
customer_reviews.text: OK I'm starting off with 4 stars bc we only just put it on and it seems to fix perfect and is made of good material. Straps are strong and elastic are also strong. Zippers seem OK a bit on the small size but will come in handy to enter camper. Also I duck taped 3/4 pipe insulation on all corners of the camper & antennas on roof to elimate sharp edges. Will no doubt come back with update and pictures...
customer_reviews.author: fabian pineros jr

customer_reviews.title: Bought in march, put on in May its rotted and falling apart!
customer_reviews.text: Have not to be honest contacted Leaders yet, however this product didn't last 6 months before the roof and front rotted off, the top looks like it might last another week, waste of money do not buy We are in Fl and yes it is hot and rainy but, this isn't worth taking out of the bag. Do not yet find an easy way to contact leaders either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fabric in the pictures appears to be thick, in reality it's very thin
customer_reviews.text: I like that it has a lots of tie-off points, but I don't like that the buckles break so easy. I was pulling on a strap to tighten the cover, but the snap-on buckle just split open. I don't yet know how this cover will perform, but I was hoping for a thicker material. They sure made it look good in pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Serge

customer_reviews.title: wasn't hard to install
customer_reviews.text: i will see next spring how well it holds up to our new england weather but it was actually quite easy to put up and over the camper. love the way it fits perfectly and the ability to tighten all the straps to keep it snug. the zipper for the door is a plus as i was able to get back inside to put some last minute things away. i did use 4 people to install it and that was probably the trick to making it easier to put up.
customer_reviews.author: d smith

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Don't pay attention to their 2 year warranty. The don't honor it. They will not answer their phones....ever! Whoever emails back you can tell by the very short sentences they do not care about their customers. Have no idea how they are even still in business!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: this cover is a little less expensive than the other ...
customer_reviews.text: this cover is a little less expensive than the other companies, but the quality appears to be the same. I think I ordered the size one too big. but it still does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Clifton J Alford

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I’m very surprised with the build quality of this cover. I had been purchasing the Adco covers which are almost twice the cost of this one, and this cover is heavier material with at least as good of construction. The Adco only lasts about two years. I think this cover should last at least that long also, maybe longer.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: 2012 Sunnybrook Sunset Creek 299 RKS
customer_reviews.text: Word to the wise if yours has a ladder, downspouts and AC and your camper is 30' buy the 30 - 33 foot cover the 30' was very hard to get it on I wish I would have gotten the next size up. It's on but not on as it should be I hope it holds up through the winter. As for the cover it's very nice and well made. Happy to say it did very well through the winter and didn't receive any damage through 50 MPH wind gusts we had in NC in February lots of rain and a few snow falls. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: jem0070

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in product.
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived damaged, though it wasn’t obvious until in was nearly fully on my RV. Two zippers were missing as was a strap. Seems like a nice cover, but I guess I won’t find out now.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Royce

customer_reviews.title: Good price and quality
customer_reviews.text: My husband was able to get this cover on our camper by himself. Not sure at first, but it went on ok. Only regret is no access door cut out. But he has still been able to get in by loosening straps and unzipping partially. We hope it will help preserve our 2015 camper. Seems to fit properly and snug enough.
customer_reviews.author: Jojo

customer_reviews.title: Get what u pay for
customer_reviews.text: Guess i got what i paid for. Fit well size wise but one end had a whole on the top corner, saw it as the majority of cover was already on camper. Also velcro straps on ends had two female clips and no male so we had to tie together
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better constructed
customer_reviews.text: I have used covers before for my RV but this one had an added feature that helped a lot. There is a strap that goes all the way around the camper to keep it tight. The previous one I had (from a different manufacturer) did not have this and the wind really beat it up badly so it had to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy  Streveler

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than what was ordered. Rips easily.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a 30 ft TT cover. What arrived would probably fit a 40ft TT. Way to big. Instructons did not match product. Ripped in two different spots while pulling over trailer which may be partially my fault as I installed by myself. Really need two people to properly install. Will see how it holds up in the stong winds we get on the Front Range. Would return but waited too long to install & I managed to rip it up during installation. Disappointed on how easy it tore. Don't see it lasting past a year.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Quality and great value
customer_reviews.text: We just put our new cover on our 30 foot travel trailer. This is a quality cover that even comes packaged with a cover carry bag to store the cover in the summer. The cover comes with tie down straps and zippers at the trailer doors so you can get in if you need to service the trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cover in great shape after a pretty harsh winter.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I waited out one winter before I did this review. I was very careful to wrap all protrusions (spoutings and door stop) with pieces insolated pading I got from our Home Chief food boxes that we have delivered and held them in place with duct tape. I just took the cover off and it is in great shape and so is the RV. We had a very windy winter with several snow storms. Happy with the cover!
customer_reviews.author: Carla W

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: fits well make sure you strap it down tight, I didn't and it ripped some during a wind storm.
customer_reviews.author: Cruis46

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: We have had this cover for 3-4 months and it does not hold up against high heat and strong winds. We live in Nevada and after just a few months it has deteriorated from the sun and shredded in recent wind. Would be nice if you don’t have “extreme” weather
customer_reviews.author: SMB

customer_reviews.title: Ripped in 5 weeks - WASTE OF MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in mid October, here we are the first week of December and the cover has already split in half due to common Michigan winter winds. So much for using the patch kit given that it ripped completely down the middle from the top of my travel trailer roof like a performer popping out of a cake! Too bad I missed the return deadline - don't waste your money on this junk!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Wooden

customer_reviews.title: Made it through the first winter in great condition with minor tear
customer_reviews.text: Made it through the first winter in great condition with minor tear, which was my own fault over a protruding screw. Was even able to fit it back into the storage bag! For the price I'm very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Downing

customer_reviews.title: One Time Use?
customer_reviews.text: We have a Passport 171EXP and it fits pretty well. The adjustable straps are nice to snug it up. We wrapped the camper up in november and here it is beginning of April and its mostly held up ok, but it has a large rip in the side and probably will not be reusable without repair or replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Hurt

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting this to be very cumbersome and difficult to put on but it wasn't. Didn't take too long at all with two people and a step ladder. The zippered entrance areas will be handy if we ever need to get in. Yet to see how it fares after a northern winter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Thin Cover!
customer_reviews.text: This cover is very thin. We have used it for one year and it ripped. We contacted the company with no response.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda McKown

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this for about 3 yrs now. This is gonna be the last yr for it as it is wintered and tearing at all corners. Its held on well threw all the wind and sun in our desert. Kinda big and bulky 2 get on and off takes about 20mins. But fits well and snug.
customer_reviews.author: MLD

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Year 2 and this thing fell apart. Like it's made of paper. Spend a little more and get something that lasts ore then 1 year.
customer_reviews.author: Aswaldo Diddles

customer_reviews.title: Did not last a winter
customer_reviews.text: This trailer cover lasted a partial winter. We covered our trailer last year in November, and by the end of Feb. the back side was torn straight across the back end. This is our second cover. The first was a Good Sam brand, and while it lasted a few winters, it too had small tears each winter that turned to big rips. I've just decided that they are WAY over priced for the quality of the product. I'm done wasting money. This year we brave the elements.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Davis

customer_reviews.title: So far , so good
customer_reviews.text: The cover was relatively easy to install. My husband and I did it in about 20 minutes . We are stil speaking to each other. The cover was easily adjusted to fit well and completely cover our Rockwood Minilite . I don’t know about durability at this time but so far so good after our first snowstorm.
customer_reviews.author: mmcd

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy: falls apart after 7months
customer_reviews.text: We bought this cover in January and it was torn to shreds by July. The roof portion of the cover was falling apart from sun damage. The picture attached is after one good wind storm. Not very sturdy. Fairly easy to install however you can’t do it by yourself (safely or easily).
customer_reviews.author: Theresa B

customer_reviews.title: Great price, but you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: What a cheaply made product, could have covered my camper with newspaper and that would have been thicker! Tore it putting it on for the first time, 50/50 my fault/manufacture fault (I feel). It came with a patch but no instructions on how to use it!?!? Can't imagine it has to be ironed on, the cover would probably melt instantaneously!!! And there are Velcro strips running vertically along the sides near the top about 4-6" long...for what?!?! Great price, but you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Brook Truby

customer_reviews.title: Holes after a month
customer_reviews.text: The material seems very thin and not very durable. After 1 month the lower side had a hole in it, the only thing under the hole was the inlet for the water line which had a plastic cap on it. I dont think this will last very long.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Pleased, but with rounded trailer front not a good form fit
customer_reviews.text: Installation is easy, just have to fight the size of it. Durability seams good, but a few seasons will tell the truth. Had to go with 20 to 22 due to spare tire and my unit being about 4 inches longer then 20'. just not completely pleased that it does not form fit our rounded trailer front securely as it does the back square area. Otherwise like it compared to most of the others that we see in the RV storage lot.
customer_reviews.author: CBS

customer_reviews.title: Put on with two people, cover your sharp edges
customer_reviews.text: Went on our 28ft travel trailer fairly easy with one person on the ground, and one on top of the trailer. Make sure you cover and sharp edges with foam or another soft material before covering or the cover will rip. Small rip already near the stairs but that was because we did not cover it with foam. Haven't owned long enough to tell about durability.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn B

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, fits like a glove.
customer_reviews.text: Cover appears to be of good quality. Material thinner than expected. Light weight made it easy to install. No instructions included, but it is not difficult to figure out. We are using this on a Gulfstream Track-N-Trail, 17', and it fits like it was made for the camper. The elastic trim along the entire bottom edge is very nice. There are also cinch straps in the correct places. I'm curious to see how it holds up to a Michigan winter.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B.

customer_reviews.title: Happy so far
customer_reviews.text: Was impressed with how well this is made considering the affordable price. When I researched buying it, covers that costed twice as much had more complaints about poor quality then this one. It fits my trailer well. Like a lot of people on here, I will update the review after the winter. I live at 6000 feet and average about 60" of snow a year along with some wind, so Ill see how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J. Shulz

customer_reviews.title: Invest a bit more.
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality. Ripped with the lightest of tug when installing the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy King

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality
customer_reviews.text: The reviews made it seem decent. It's not even waterproof and tears SOOO easily. Literally ripped while trying to be super careful putting it on. Looked out a couple of days later and saw drain spout poked another hold in it. Kept because snow and ice were coming and we didn't have another one in mind to order. Would not repurchase. Now I know why the price was cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Open on the ground the fist time
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you open this cover and unfold on the ground the first time you take it out of the package. It is not packaged to just take on the roof and unfold. You need to refold it to you can easily unfold on the roof. Zip the front zippers first. I zipped the back first and the front was difficult to zip because of the curved front - the back is square and the zippers line up better once the cover starts getting snug. It fits well for me. I just put it on so I don't have an info on how well it holds up to the weather in the midwest.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, not great.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted two seasons before it tore through in the corners and along one seam. I covered gutter spots with pool noodles. When in good condition it worked perfectly. Kept the rain off and worked as it should. Even though it only lasted two seasons. I guess $80 bucks a year isn’t bad. I’ll most likely purchase another one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this!
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of crap! No poles plus everytime we pulled on it, it tore. Had to tape the holes up with gorilla tape! Couldn’t send it back, too late to get another one!😢
customer_reviews.author: not hot!

customer_reviews.title: Not the quality we expected!
customer_reviews.text: After putting the cover on the trailer, we noticed there is a hole on the side of the cover. Wether it was there before installing or not is hard to say but we were careful putting it on & never pulled hard to get it unhooked from anything. Regardless, for the price we thought it'd be more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Jewel

customer_reviews.title: Very nice cover- Good fit
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and secure with attached straps, fit perfectly, has been on for almost a month with no problems obviously I cannot comment on how it holds up over time but will say it appears very well made out of good material
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: My wife Purchased the cover as a gift for me two months ago just before a series of trips. We will not be going out for a couple months so She gave it to me. I was going to cover it for the first time. My trailer is a 28’. The cover said 27-30’. She figured it would be a little loose. I got it on and zipped the back and the front is short 2 full feet from being able to zip closed. I pulled every bit of possible slack and it is still two feet short. Now because I have had it two months I am stuck with it because Amazon only has a 30 day return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Santone

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Spent tons of money on tarps every year only to have them tear or come off mid winter. This was easy to install and covered all the important parts! Haven’t been through the winter with it yet but not too worried!
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: Not for use in sun...will decay
customer_reviews.text: Put on the trailer in March, it's now June and the top of the cover is already decaying. There are holes forming at the corners and where it runs from wind. Poor quality, not UV protected. Do not recommend for any trailer that is parked in sun.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fabric is really thin.
customer_reviews.text: It tore in three places while I was putting it on. Fabric is really thin.
customer_reviews.author: Fredbear

customer_reviews.title: This cover fit my Roo19 perfectly
customer_reviews.text: this cover did not show up on time it was almost a week later than what was said when i purchased it it fit perfectly and seems to be durable and sheds water. i really like the straps that go all the way around the camper on top of the cover. i believe this feature will make it last long because it stops a good amount of the flapping in the wind. time will tell how good it really is in this Chicago area wind and weather
customer_reviews.author: Eaglesparks

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.text: The cover fit our 28' toy hauler fine, it covered the tongue also which was a plus. For the first time unrolling it I rolled it most the way out on our car. Found front, and pulled it up on the roof from the rear. was fairly easy no issues. When we took it off I rolled the sides up, folded it up on the roof and rolled it up. We had it on and off in 20 minutes or so. It will tear if your not careful, but the quality is is up there with the ones that cost more. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly on a 39ft trailer. Easy to install, took 30 min by my self. Added bonus, the storage bag fit over the lp tanks. Looks great, blends in with the area and does not stand out. Highly recommend expecially for the low cost.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Holtzclaw

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Upon receiving the cover, the quick install instructions stated there were supposed to be rods included to assist with lifting the cover over the camper. Mine did not include the rods, and I was not able to get the cover over the camper. $145 worth of camper cover is now just sitting in my garage. It is a heavy duty cover, very well made, but there is nothing easy about the instillation.
customer_reviews.author: JNC

customer_reviews.title: So far happy customer
customer_reviews.text: I'm rating 4 only because we haven't had it long enough to verify durability. Husband had it on by himself in about 15 mins, fit very nicely, love door access, looks durable.. right now can't one bad thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made camper cover!!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this cover for our camper in October and received it in December. We put it on and strapped it down for the winter. Within a week the straps had broken. We are now in the beginning of March and the fabric is splitting where the straps were sewn on. This product is definitely not worth the money. It is poorly constructed and not durable.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Stirton

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to cut through the fabric. I had two places where I had to use the supplied repairing material. I think most new to using a cover will experience similar problems. Now that i know there's a trick to putting them on i will be looking to prevent it next time. I would guess no matter what brand you purchase you will have these issues. Take your time asking them carefully as you go. For the money, this was a good purchase. Hope it lasts, only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Carey H.

customer_reviews.title: Do not waist your money on this garbage!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not waist your money on this garbage, Bought thinking this would keep my travel trailer project for a least 4 , 5 winter, And it did not worked. Ripped on a 15 mile per hour wind, I contacted Amazon, they said they have nothing to do with it, and said to me to contact the seller, i did called them, emails them, and no a single response by this crap company. Again, do not buy this !!!
customer_reviews.author: Emerson Vieira

customer_reviews.title: Cheap material
customer_reviews.text: Said it would fit 24’ to 27’ camper but Did not fit 27’ camper it’s made from very cheap material ripped huge hole in side of cover just putting it on will never buy another one. This is my second one like this first one lasted 7 months and fell apart. Don’t waste your money !!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Took a long time to receive it.
customer_reviews.text: Took all most 5 weeks to receive it. Said I would have it within 2 weeks. Once I got it and put it on it seem to be working like it should. We will see after winter what happens.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty fultz

customer_reviews.title: Good if you only need it a couple months
customer_reviews.text: It didn’t leak at all. I’m parked under a huge tree and still half of it, starting a the seam, is deteriorating. Leaks bad after 4 months. I wish I could get my money back
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Trevino

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: A learning curve to install solo. A bit large for my 16’ Jayco Hummingbird but does cover well. Will cover front tounge and tires. For price, good protection from sun and rain.
customer_reviews.author: misterdaveusa

customer_reviews.title: I almost cried
customer_reviews.text: The cover tore a large hole the first time putting on. Once it was completely on we had to sew up the gash with needle and thread. All it takes is one object to catch on and it will rip. Waste of my money:(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Had a horrible experience trying to put it on took 3 grown men. Covered all the sharp edges with foam blocks. Very long hateful story short didn't make it a week before there wasn't anything left to even send back for a refund. Lasted 4 days
customer_reviews.author: thomas willoughby

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: Product was to short camper is 31” and bought a cover 30-33’ and it’s way to short and it tore easily in front and they haven’t sent replacement or refund which I prefer since it’s not of quality but at this point I’ll take a replacement that’s fits if they are not going to refund my money
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Bethune

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but takes at least 2 people to put on and has already torn in a couple areas
customer_reviews.text: It sort of a pain to "install". Definitely need at least 2 people. Fits perfectly, but already has a couple small tairs, after less than 2 months being on.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased. Fit our travel trailer really good
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased.Fit our travel trailer really good.Thanks for a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: This Lady LOVES this cover, and easy install!
customer_reviews.text: This lady LOVES the fact I can get inside with the cover on, and it was super easy for me to install by myself! Due to the fact it is made to fit 27-30ft trailers it was big for mine, but great! In the past I had covers that were tight and they just ripped! I was able to make it fit just fine. I am very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a Year in SoCal Weather
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting it to perform a lot better seeing as we don't get a lot of bad weather, but the cover split about 8 months into usage. Now it's completely torn and useless.
customer_reviews.author: ninja

customer_reviews.title: Ripped
customer_reviews.text: This thing was ok. We live in Northern Indiana. It’s cold, Windy, rainy, hot, all in 2 weeks. It did well beginning of winter late October, by April it’s ripped all over. Will be sending back.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: The product is exactly as advertised. Easy to install. My boyfriend got on the roof. I was on the ground. It took us about 30 mins to install. We’ve had several big storms and it’s protected our travel trailer nicely. Great to have zippers for door access in case you need to enter the coach.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy L

customer_reviews.title: Great cover, but hard to get over the camper and rips on the downspouts.
customer_reviews.text: The cover is great. It fits perfectly and stays on in all kinds of weather, but it took 4 of us to be able to get the cover over the camper and I had to put foam (cut up pool noodles) around the downspouts on the corners of the camper to keep it from ripping.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Ireland

customer_reviews.title: Protect your investment
customer_reviews.text: You will need help to put this on!! It’s a great cover for the price. Fits awesome. Snugs up nice and you are still able to get inside if needed. But you should have two ladders for sure. Two people for sure are needed. It’s not easy to flip over the AC or anything else on the roof. I had to use a long pole to flip most of it over.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Need help putting it on!
customer_reviews.text: Need 2 people and a ladder to put this on. It seems to offer good protection but it needs some extra straps to help keep in on when the wind is bad. Overall we are happy with it and we’ll get another if ours gets damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy A.

product_meta.title: Leader Accessories Premium 300D Upgrade Travel Trailer RV Cover Fits 27'-30' Camper Outdoor Protect Trailer Cover, Beige
feature_bullets: Fits RV 27'-30', Size: 366"L*102"W*104"H, 2-Year warranty .Within the Warranty Period, We always offer excellent after-sale service for this item.

[Premium Material]: UPGRADED 300D ripstop polyester fabric + Anti-uv coating + PU coating, reinforced cotton PVC lining, double stitch seams make the RV cover more anti-aging, scratch resistant and tearproof
[Windproof]: Many waterproof Straps & Buckles at bottom, 2 extra long straps and front cross-strap panel to resist the wind better. Reduce rip in the heavy wind.
[Easy Access]: Multiple zippered panels allow access to the RV doors and engine areas anytime. Full cut to allow room for ladders, air conditioners etc. Ladder cap and storage bag included.
[Easy Installation]: Air vent system reduces wind stress and vent inside moisture. Weighted buckle toss-under for easy installation.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars804 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
